{"body": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement ", "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Introduction\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\n## Purpose\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to the T&C)\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: ValidAI\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nAshutosh\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [59], "receiver_account": "hashkat.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130168219}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @hashkat.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement \\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=79)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\n## Purpose\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to the T&C)\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: ValidAI\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nAshutosh\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [59], "receiver_account": "hashkat.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "hashkat.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 79, "body": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement ", "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Introduction\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\n## Purpose\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated breakdown:\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to the T&C)\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: ValidAI\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nProject Link to ETH Global Submission: https://ethglobal.com/showcase/validai-kx6ou\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nAshutosh\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "hashkat.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}

{"body": {"name": "Moraq Leagues Travel Stipend Request for Redacted IRL", "summary": "Moraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round AI powered prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards. We are also coming up with a AI powered DEFI platform for lending/borrowing.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "### Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 2 developers from India.\\\\n\\\\n1. Sushmit Sarmah, a full-stack developer with over 12 years of experience..  \\\\n2. Harshal Bhangale, a full stack developer and a student from IIT Madras  \\\\n\\\\nMy Github profile and Personal website\\\\nhttps://sushmitsarmah.github.io/\\\\nhttps://github.com/sushmitsarmah\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal is for me, Sushmit Sarmah.\\\\n\\\\n### Description\\\\nWe are building Moraq Leagues, a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.\\\\nAnother part of it is an AI powered DEFI lending/borrowing platform which can be used to play more of the game\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop Moraq Leagues during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n### Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve Moraq Leagues and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential to create real-world value in decentralized gaming and finance. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n### Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $325 (Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand, round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $175\\\\nMy Request: $500\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and accommodation. We will manage other expenses such as food and local transport ourselves.\\\\n\\\\n### Project Overview:\\\\nMoraq Leagues is a prediction-based gaming platform that offers a fun and competitive environment for users to predict crypto or stock prices. Users participate in multiple rounds, and after each round, the bottom 50% are eliminated. Players can choose to cash out early or continue for bigger rewards. We are excited to build Moraq Leagues on the NEAR Protocol, leveraging its low transaction fees and scalability.\\\\nWe are very old near fans and experienced in Near tech stack.\\\\n\\\\n### Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining few of our hackathons link we participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\nPhotostock - Nearcon 2023 Lisbon Portugal Link : https://devpost.com/software/photostock\\\\nFunctionland Innovation Boost Zone - Near Metabuild 3 Link : https://devpost.com/software/functionland-innovation-boost-zone\\\\nWagerbox - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/wagerbox-0nej9\\\\nBlitzsquad - ETHGlobal Showcase : .https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blitzsquad-2jt43\\\\nPlayAstra - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/playastra-nsc3w\\\\nTribeviz - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tribeviz-a3za7\\\\nSuperwallet - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/superwallet-wvqtj\\\\nhttps://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\n\\\\n### Why I Need Support\\\\nAs a developer, I am committed to covering as many costs as possible myself, but the cost of flights is a bit challenging. Your support would allow me to attend the hackathon and focus on building and improving our project without financial strain.\\\\n\\\\n### Conclusion\\\\nI am eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok to showcase Moraq Leagues and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and enable us to bring our project to life.\\\\nThank you for considering our request.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "f58a611082e5f7d913749144019b7a4e355049a2be5d1574f107c65b26298a14", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130173796}

This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards. We are also coming up with a AI powered DEFI platform for lending/borrowing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=80)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "Stipend Proposal for Moraq Leagues aka Moraq-gaming for Redacted IRL ", "summary": "Moraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round AI powered prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards. We are also coming up with a AI powered DEFI platform for lending/borrowing.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "## Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 2 developers from India.\\\\n\\\\n1. Harshal Bhangale, a full stack developer Intern at ordex.ai and a student from IIT Madras\\\\n2. Sushmit Sarmah, a full-stack developer with over 12 years of experience..\\\\n\\\\n### My Github profile and Personal website\\\\nhttps://github.com/HarshalBhangale\\\\nhttps://Buddyharshal.me\\\\n\\\\nhttps://sushmitsarmah.github.io/\\\\nhttps://github.com/sushmitsarmah\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal is for, Harshal Bhangale \\\\n\\\\n### Description\\\\nWe are building Moraq Leagues, a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.\\\\nAnother part of it is an AI powered DEFI lending/borrowing platform which can be used to play more of the game\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop Moraq Leagues during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n### Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve Moraq Leagues and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential to create real-world value in decentralized gaming and finance. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n### Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $380 (Mumbai, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand, round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $240 (20$ hostel x 12 Nights) = $ 120\\\\nMy Request: $500\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and bit accommodation. We will manage accomodation and rest expenses of food and other misc expenses on out own.\\\\n\\\\n### Project Overview:\\\\nMoraq Leagues is a prediction-based gaming platform that offers a fun and competitive environment for users to predict crypto or stock prices. Users participate in multiple rounds, and after each round, the bottom 50% are eliminated. Players can choose to cash out early or continue for bigger rewards. We are excited to build Moraq Leagues on the NEAR Protocol, leveraging its low transaction fees and scalability.\\\\nWe are very old near fans and experienced in Near tech stack.\\\\n\\\\n### Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining few of our hackathons link we participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\nWe started Moraq Leagues here : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nbut we were not able to make a concrete version during Ethglobal Singapore, where we met @codegoon and amazing near folks at near booth and which lead us to go deeper into near Ai agents that can help us make prediction bots for crypto prices on top of moraq Leagues.\\\\n\\\\nPhotostock - Nearcon 2023 Lisbon Portugal Link : https://devpost.com/software/photostock\\\\nFunctionland Innovation Boost Zone - Near Metabuild 3 Link : https://devpost.com/software/functionland-innovation-boost-zone\\\\nWagerbox - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/wagerbox-0nej9\\\\nBlitzsquad - ETHGlobal Showcase : .https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blitzsquad-2jt43\\\\nPlayAstra - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/playastra-nsc3w\\\\nTribeviz - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tribeviz-a3za7\\\\nSuperwallet - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/superwallet-wvqtj\\\\nPassportGlobal - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/passportglobal-jptoi\\\\nERCMEME BASE HACK : https://devfolio.co/projects/ercmeme-9760\\\\nETHMUMBAI 2024 : https://devfolio.co/projects/whispercash-a588\\\\nChainlink Hack : https://devpost.com/software/dna-id https://devpost.com/software/chainlink-wrapper-for-fxblox-staking-v0-2-functions\\\\nhttps://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nAptos Winterschool Project: TribeBet : https://pitch.com/v/TribeBet-49ggp4/2923de38-72e3-436c-abcd-8339cab40cfe\\\\n\\\\nand Many more exciting projects \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Why I Need Support\\\\nAs a student coming from a economically weak background, I am committed to towards REDACTED online hack and on track of a very cool submission, but the cost of flights is a bit challenging for me. Your support would allow me to attend the hackathon ie. IRL Redacted in Bangkok and focus on building and improving our project without any financial strain.\\\\n\\\\n### Conclusion\\\\nI am eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok to showcase Moraq Leagues and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and enable us to bring our project to life.\\\\nThank you for considering our request.", "linked_proposals": [80, 61], "receiver_account": "733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 130176608}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Stipend Proposal for Moraq Leagues aka Moraq-gaming for Redacted IRL \\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nMoraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round AI powered prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards. We are also coming up with a AI powered DEFI platform for lending/borrowing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=81)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 81, "snapshot": {"name": "Stipend Proposal for Moraq Leagues aka Moraq-gaming for Redacted IRL ", "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "summary": "Moraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round AI powered prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards. We are also coming up with a AI powered DEFI platform for lending/borrowing.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff", "timestamp": "1728749927954639943", "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "## Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 2 developers from India.\\\\n\\\\n1. Harshal Bhangale, a full stack developer Intern at ordex.ai and a student from IIT Madras\\\\n2. Sushmit Sarmah, a full-stack developer with over 12 years of experience..\\\\n\\\\n### My Github profile and Personal website\\\\nhttps://github.com/HarshalBhangale\\\\nhttps://Buddyharshal.me\\\\n\\\\nhttps://sushmitsarmah.github.io/\\\\nhttps://github.com/sushmitsarmah\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal is for, Harshal Bhangale \\\\n\\\\n### Description\\\\nWe are building Moraq Leagues, a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.\\\\nAnother part of it is an AI powered DEFI lending/borrowing platform which can be used to play more of the game\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop Moraq Leagues during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n### Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve Moraq Leagues and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential to create real-world value in decentralized gaming and finance. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n### Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $380 (Mumbai, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand, round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $240 (20$ hostel x 12 Nights) = $ 120\\\\nMy Request: $500\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and bit accommodation. We will manage accomodation and rest expenses of food and other misc expenses on out own.\\\\n\\\\n### Project Overview:\\\\nMoraq Leagues is a prediction-based gaming platform that offers a fun and competitive environment for users to predict crypto or stock prices. Users participate in multiple rounds, and after each round, the bottom 50% are eliminated. Players can choose to cash out early or continue for bigger rewards. We are excited to build Moraq Leagues on the NEAR Protocol, leveraging its low transaction fees and scalability.\\\\nWe are very old near fans and experienced in Near tech stack.\\\\n\\\\n### Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining few of our hackathons link we participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\nWe started Moraq Leagues here : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nbut we were not able to make a concrete version during Ethglobal Singapore, where we met @codegoon and amazing near folks at near booth and which lead us to go deeper into near Ai agents that can help us make prediction bots for crypto prices on top of moraq Leagues.\\\\n\\\\nPhotostock - Nearcon 2023 Lisbon Portugal Link : https://devpost.com/software/photostock\\\\nFunctionland Innovation Boost Zone - Near Metabuild 3 Link : https://devpost.com/software/functionland-innovation-boost-zone\\\\nWagerbox - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/wagerbox-0nej9\\\\nBlitzsquad - ETHGlobal Showcase : .https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blitzsquad-2jt43\\\\nPlayAstra - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/playastra-nsc3w\\\\nTribeviz - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tribeviz-a3za7\\\\nSuperwallet - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/superwallet-wvqtj\\\\nPassportGlobal - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/passportglobal-jptoi\\\\nERCMEME BASE HACK : https://devfolio.co/projects/ercmeme-9760\\\\nETHMUMBAI 2024 : https://devfolio.co/projects/whispercash-a588\\\\nChainlink Hack : https://devpost.com/software/dna-id https://devpost.com/software/chainlink-wrapper-for-fxblox-staking-v0-2-functions\\\\nhttps://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nAptos Winterschool Project: TribeBet : https://pitch.com/v/TribeBet-49ggp4/2923de38-72e3-436c-abcd-8339cab40cfe\\\\n\\\\nand Many more exciting projects \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Why I Need Support\\\\nAs a student coming from a economically weak background, I am committed to towards REDACTED online hack and on track of a very cool submission, but the cost of flights is a bit challenging for me. Your support would allow me to attend the hackathon ie. IRL Redacted in Bangkok and focus on building and improving our project without any financial strain.\\\\n\\\\n### Conclusion\\\\nI am eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok to showcase Moraq Leagues and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and enable us to bring our project to life.\\\\nThank you for considering our request.", "linked_proposals": [80, 61], "receiver_account": "733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 81, "body": {"name": "Stipend Proposal for Moraq Leagues aka Moraq-gaming for Redacted IRL ", "summary": "Moraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round AI powered prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "## Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 2 developers from India.\\\\n\\\\n1. Harshal Bhangale, a full stack developer Intern at ordex.ai and a student from IIT Madras\\\\n2. Sushmit Sarmah, a full-stack developer with over 12 years of experience..\\\\n\\\\n### My Github profile and Personal website\\\\nhttps://github.com/HarshalBhangale\\\\nhttps://Buddyharshal.me\\\\n\\\\nhttps://sushmitsarmah.github.io/\\\\nhttps://github.com/sushmitsarmah\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal is for, Harshal Bhangale \\\\n\\\\n### Description\\\\nWe are building Moraq Leagues, a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.\\\\nAnother part of it is an AI powered DEFI lending/borrowing platform which can be used to play more of the game\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop Moraq Leagues during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n### Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve Moraq Leagues and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential to create real-world value in decentralized gaming and finance. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n### Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $380 (Mumbai, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand, round trip)\\\\nAccommodation per person: $240 (20$ hostel x 12 Nights) = $ 120\\\\nMy Request: $500\\\\n\\\\nI am only requesting assistance for flights and bit accommodation. We will manage accomodation and rest expenses of food and other misc expenses on out own.\\\\n\\\\n### Project Overview:\\\\nMoraq Leagues is a prediction-based gaming platform that offers a fun and competitive environment for users to predict crypto or stock prices. Users participate in multiple rounds, and after each round, the bottom 50% are eliminated. Players can choose to cash out early or continue for bigger rewards. We are excited to build Moraq Leagues on the NEAR Protocol, leveraging its low transaction fees and scalability.\\\\nWe are very old near fans and experienced in Near tech stack.\\\\n\\\\n### Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining few of our hackathons link we participated in the past :\\\\nWe have won more than 15+hackathon Winner \\\\nWe started Moraq Leagues here : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nbut we were not able to make a concrete version during Ethglobal Singapore, where we met @codegoon and amazing near folks at near booth and which lead us to go deeper into near Ai agents that can help us make prediction bots for crypto prices on top of moraq Leagues.\\\\n\\\\nPhotostock - Nearcon 2023 Lisbon Portugal Link : https://devpost.com/software/photostock\\\\nFunctionland Innovation Boost Zone - Near Metabuild 3 Link : https://devpost.com/software/functionland-innovation-boost-zone\\\\nWagerbox - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/wagerbox-0nej9\\\\nBlitzsquad - ETHGlobal Showcase : .https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blitzsquad-2jt43\\\\nPlayAstra - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/playastra-nsc3w\\\\nTribeviz - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tribeviz-a3za7\\\\nSuperwallet - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/superwallet-wvqtj\\\\nPassportGlobal - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/passportglobal-jptoi\\\\nERCMEME BASE HACK : https://devfolio.co/projects/ercmeme-9760\\\\nETHMUMBAI 2024 : https://devfolio.co/projects/whispercash-a588\\\\nChainlink Hack : https://devpost.com/software/dna-id https://devpost.com/software/chainlink-wrapper-for-fxblox-staking-v0-2-functions\\\\nhttps://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\nAptos Winterschool Project Finalist at IIT Bombay : TribeBet : https://pitch.com/v/TribeBet-49ggp4/2923de38-72e3-436c-abcd-8339cab40cfe\\\\nhttps://aptosfoundation.org/currents/aptos-winter-school-celebrating-innovation-collaboration-and-academia-with-trust-lab\\\\nCreator and Lead at : angrypets.io memecoin project\\\\nLead at supersol.xyz\\\\n\\\\nand Many more exciting projects \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Why I Need Support\\\\nAs a student coming from a economically weak background, I am committed to towards REDACTED online hack and on track of a very cool submission, but the cost of flights is a bit challenging for me. Your support would allow me to attend the hackathon ie. IRL Redacted in Bangkok and focus on building and improving our project without any financial strain.\\\\n\\\\n### Conclusion\\\\nI am eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok to showcase Moraq Leagues and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and enable us to bring our project to life.\\\\nThank you for considering our request.", "linked_proposals": [61], "receiver_account": "733042511ad4dac6e0e32e8f4fb0ae83d13a4d67cd466ed3f748a9b4bbb2f9ff", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"]}
